dialogue:
#Person1#: Hi, are you in Warsaw
#Person2#: yes, just back! Btw are you free for diner the 19th?
#Person1#: nope!
#Person2#: and the 18th?
#Person1#: nope, we have this party and you must be there, remember?

#Person2#: with pleasure!
#Person1#: friday?
#Person2#: ok
#Person2#: what do you mean " we don't have any more whisky!" lol..
#Person1#: what!!!
#Person2#: you just call me and the all thing i heard was that sentence about whisky... what's wrong with you?
#Person1#: oh oh... very strange! i have to be carefull may be there is some spy in my mobile! lol
#Person2#: dont' worry, we'll check on friday.
#Person1#: don't forget to bring some sun with you
#Person2#: I can't wait to be in Morocco..
#Person1#: enjoy and see you friday
#Person2#: sorry Ollie, i'm very busy, i won't have time for lunch tomorrow, but may be at 6pm after my courses?this trip to Morocco was so nice, but time consuming!
#Person1#: ok for tea!
#Person2#: I'm on my way..
#Person1#: tea is ready, did you bring the pastries?
#Person2#: I already ate them all... see you in a minute
#Person1#: ok
summary: #Person2# is in Warsaw. #Person1# and #Person2# has a party. #Person2# lost her calendar. They will get a lunch this week on Friday. #Person1# accidentally called #Person2# and talked about whisky. #Person2# cancels lunch. They'll meet for a tea at 6 pm.

dialogue:
#Person1#: Hey guys, what are we doing with the keys today?
#Person2#: I've got them. Whoever wants them can meet me at lunchtime or after
#Person3#: I'm ok. We're meeting for the drinks in the evening anyway and I guess we'll be going back to the apartment together?
#Person2#: Yeah, I guess so
#Person4#: I'm with Hilary atm and won't let go of her for the rest of the day, so any option you guys choose is good for me
#Person1#: Hmm I might actually pass by at lunchtime, take the keys and go take a nap. I'm sooo tired after yesterday
#Person2#: Sounds good. We'll be having lunch with some French people (the ones who work on the history of food in colonial Mexico - I already see you yawning your head off)
#Person1#: YAAAAWN [SHY] Where and where are you meeting?
#Person2#: So I'm meeting them at the entrance to the conference hall at 2 pm and then we'll head to this place called La Cantina. Italian cuisine, which is quite funny, but that's what they've chosen
#Person1#: Interesting üò± To be honest, Hilary, I almost feel like changing my mind. Wanting to take this nap might end up costing me to dear
#Person2#: Oh come on [LAUGH]
#Person1#: All these terrible obstacles on mu way to bed might just prove to much to take
#Person2#: We'll try to avoid talking about their subject of research. Oh wait, no, I'm actually meeting them because I wanted to chat about their research lol
#Person3#: üôâ
#Person2#: Do join us, we're going to have fun. And then you'll take the keys and take this most deserved of naps
#Person3#: Sounds like a plan [LAUGH]
#Person2#: üòé
#Person3#: See you at 2 then xx
summary: #Person2# has the keys to the apartment. #Person1# wants to get them and go take a nap. #Person2# is having lunch with some French people at La Cantina. #Person2# is meeting them at the entrance to the conference hall at 2 pm. #Person1# and #Person3# might join them. They're meeting for the drinks in the evening.

dialogue:
#Person1#: Shit, I've got so much to do at work and I'm so demotivated.
#Person2#: It's pretty irresponsible to give that much work to someone on their notice period.
#Person1#: Yeah, exactly! Should I even care?
#Person2#: It's up to you, but you know what they say...
#Person1#: What do you mean?
#Person2#: Well, they say how you end things shows how you really are...
#Person1#: And now how you start, right?
#Person2#: Gotcha!
#Person1#: So what shall I do then?
#Person2#: It's only two weeks left, so grit your teeth and do what you have to do.
#Person1#: Easy to say, hard to perform.
#Person2#: Come on, stop thinking, start doing!
#Person1#: That's so typical of you![WINK]
summary: #Person1# has a lot of work on his notice period and he feels demotivated. #Person2# thinks he should do what he has to do nevertheless.

dialogue:
#Person1#: Hi, what you up to?
#Person2#: Not much, chilling out.
#Person1#: Just rewatching Dear White People on Netflix, love it!üòç
#Person2#: Oh yeah, heard of it, but not seen it yet? Any good?
#Person1#: Well, yes! I just said it was, LOL. It's about a fictional Ivy League University and the students in one House of Residence.
#Person2#: Why is it called Dear White People?
#Person1#: That's the name of the radio show the main character, Sam, presents on college radio.
#Person2#: Yeah, but why is it so good?
#Person1#: Well, it's mainly stories from the perspective of black students there, which I find very interesting. The characters are strong and likeable too.
#Person2#: I suppose it's rather different from the UK, then?
#Person1#: It seems so, as there is a lot more racial awareness and discrimination there than here. It all kicks off when there is a Blackface party held by an elite group of white students, which gets out of hand.
#Person2#: How's that?
#Person1#: Well, obviously, the black students try to break it up and there's also an incident where one guy, Reggie, gets a loaded gun pointed at him by a campus policeman after he gets into an argument with a white student. It may be at another party, though, I'm not sure of that.
#Person2#: Oh, that sounds pretty strong stuff. What else happens?
#Person1#: Well, there is a young black guy called Lionel who is coming to terms with being gay and is finding his voice as a journalist. He unearths corruption at the uni and he and Sam also uncover some conspiracy theory stuff about secret societies.
#Person2#: Well, I must say, it does sound good, I'll check it out soon!
#Person1#: Definitely, there is supposed to be a Series 3 coming up next year, really looking forward to it!
#Person2#: Well, thanks Clara, I'm just watching the rest of a movie and I'll try Dear White People.
#Person1#: Don't blame me if you get hooked and stay up till 4!
#Person2#: See ya, love!
#Person1#: Bye!
summary: #Person1# is rewatching Dear White People and strongly recommends it to #Person2#.

dialogue:
#Person1#: Hi Beth, how are you love?
#Person2#: Hi Auntie Deirdre, I'm been meaning to message you, had a favour to ask.
#Person1#: Wondered if you had any thought about your Mum's 40th, we've got to do something special!
#Person2#: How about a girls weekend, just mum, me, you and the girls, Kira will have to come back from Uni, of course.
#Person1#: Sounds fab! Get your thinking cap on, it's only in 6 weeks! Bet she's dreading it, I remember doing that!
#Person2#: Oh yeah, we had a surprise party for you, you nearly had a heart attack!
#Person1#: Well, it was a lovely surprise! Gosh, thats nearly 4 years ago now, time flies! What was the favour, darling?
#Person2#: Oh, it was just that I fancied trying a bit of work experience in the salon, auntie.
#Person1#: Well, I am looking for Saturday girls, are you sure about it? you could do well in the exams and go on to college or 6th form.
#Person2#: I know, but it's not for me, auntie, I am doing all foundation papers and I'm struggling with those.
#Person1#: What about a tutor? Kira could help you in the hols.
#Person2#: Maybe, but I'd like to try working. I'm 16 soon, I'm old enough.
#Person1#: I know. Look, pop in tomorrow after school and we'll have a cuppa and a chat.
#Person2#: Yes, thanks auntie. I'd really like to try the beauty therapy side.
#Person1#: Its not for the squeamish, mind. Massage, pedicures, not to mention waxing!
#Person2#: Oh yes, I was chatting to a friend about it yesterday!
#Person1#: Maxine manages the beauty side, you can meet her tomorrow and we'll see how it goes.
#Person2#: Yes, I'd really like that.
#Person1#: We can try a few hours on a Saturday for a couple of weeks as work experience. I'll give you a tenner or so per session to start off for your lunch, coffee and bus fare etc. If you like, we'll take it from there.
#Person2#: OK, I like the sound of it! See you tomorrow Auntie! Love you!
#Person1#: Bye, lovely girl! Xx
summary: #Person2# wants to organize a girls weekend to celebrate her mother's 40th birthday. She also wants to work at Deidre's beauty salon. Deidre offers her a few hours on Saturdays as work experience. They set up for a meeting tomorrow.

dialogue:
#Person1#: Have you talked to May?
#Person2#: Yes, yesterday, why?
#Person1#: I just talked to her and I must admit I worry about her
#Person2#: Me too, I suggested she should see a specialist, but she wasn't very happy about it
#Person1#: No wonder...
#Person2#: I know, but I think this is serious. She's saying she's depressed, like everyone around, but in her case it may be true
#Person1#: She was telling me she doesn't feel like doing anything, she's bored all the time, she never feels happy. It sounds like a real, typical depression
#Person1#: She also told me that she has trouble sleeping. I asked her to go out for a beer or anything basically, but she doesn't want to leave the flat
#Person2#: Oh my, it sounds really serious. I don't what to tell you
#Person1#: I was wondering how I can help her
#Person2#: Honestly I don't know if we can help her, Adam. I suggested a specialist because these are very sensitive issues and I'm afraid we may unintentionally make it worse
#Person1#: Yes, but she doesn't want to see a specialist. Basically, she doesn't want to see anyone
#Person2#: Hm... I don't know... How about I call someone for advice? So we could know what to do
#Person1#: Sounds rational, do you know anyone you could call? Don't mention her name
#Person2#: Of course I won't! I have a friend who's a psychologist, we can trust her. I'll let you know
#Person1#: Thank you Karen!
summary: #Person1# and #Person2# are worried that May suffers from depression. #Person2# will call her friend who is a psychologist and ask for advice.

dialogue:
#Person1#: Okay, Kelly! Ur up nxt!
#Person2#: Me? I don't wanna.
#Person3#: C'mon!
#Person4#: Yeah! What's yours?
#Person2#: Fine. It's a sculpture garden in Finnland.
#Person1#: What's scary about sculptures? Wait! Do they resemble vampires and stuff?
#Person3#: Nah, I'm sure they look rly nice.
#Person2#: It's not the sculptures, it's the amount of them and their faces!
#Person4#: Faces? What faces?
#Person2#: Well, they resemble ppl in different activities like hugging, training, doing sport and so on. But the faces are just morbid and there's like a hundred of them. All staring at you!
#Person1#: Another one?
#Person3#: Certainly!
#Person4#: Well, Ollie, ur turn!
#Person1#: Nagoro village in Japan!
#Person3#: Y?
#Person1#: Well, maybe it's not scary, but it similar to Kelly's place. It's just creepy as hell.
#Person4#: Bt y?
#Person1#: Imagine a village with ppl living in it. And in the same village u have these human-sized figures. And there's more of them than the ppl that actually live there!
#Person2#: Creepy AH!
#Person3#: WTF?! Y would ppl even do that?
#Person4#: Idk. Idc. Never. Going. There.
#Person1#: See! Mine was the worst!
#Person4#: Bt not the scariest!
#Person1#: Point taken.
#Person3#: Listen, guys, fun talking to u, bt gotta go.
#Person2#: Yeah, me too. Bye!
#Person4#: Bye!
#Person1#: Cu!
summary: #Person2# is scared of sculpture garden figures in Finnland, she finds figure's faces morbid. For #Person1# it's Nagoro village in Japan, it's creepy.

dialogue:
#Person1#: Hello, is this Sandra Donovan?
#Person2#: Yes, well that was my maiden name, it's Sandra Taylor now.
#Person1#: It's Brenda Riley, we used to work together in the clothes factory!
#Person2#: Oh my God! Bren! How are you, it must be 25 years!
#Person1#: I'm fine, I live in Stoke now, moved away from Brum in the late 90s.
#Person2#: I still live in Kings Norton, same house, same husband! I've got 4 grandchildren now, ages 2, 4, 9 and 15! How about you?
#Person1#: Unfortunately, my husband Bill died 5 years ago, I have only one grandchild, she's 7, my little angel, she doesn't remember her Gramps.
#Person2#: So sorry, love, I remember your Bill, he had long black hair and massive sideburns, didn't he?
#Person1#: Well, yes, about 45 years ago, he was bald when he passed away. He loved to dance, he did Northern Soul, we both did actually. Went up to Wigan on weekends, happy times!
#Person2#: Oh yes, I remember that craze, bit energetic for me! We liked disco instead! We had some great dinner dances with the factory, do you remember them?
#Person1#: Yes! Us all dressed up with our long dresses and the men with their frilly evening shirts, lovely memories!
#Person2#: Do you still see any of the girls from Lister's?
#Person1#: No, but I heard that Marigold Carter died, very sad.
#Person2#: Hey Bren, I've had a brainwave! How about we organise a reunion for the Lister's girls, look on social media for them?
#Person1#: Actually, I was thinking along those lines! Do you fancy meeting up, just you and me? I can come down to Birmingham anytime.
#Person2#: That would be lovely! Can you manage it next Saturday? We could meet about 11ish and go for lunch and a good old trip down memory lane!
#Person1#: Oh yes! I'd love that! I'll get back to you about train times soon!
#Person2#: Ok! Bye love!
summary: #Person2# and #Person1# used to work together in the clothes factory 25 years ago. #Person2# still lives in Kings Norton. #Person1# lives in Stoke now. Her husband Bill died 5 years ago. They will meet in Birmingham for a lunch next Saturday about 11. They want to organize a reunion for the Lister's girls.

#Person2#: i would totally freak out

dialogue:
#Person1#: I think I'm through with the dickhead. He's being a pain again. I'm going to tell him to move out.
#Person2#: Did he at least give you back the money he owes you?
#Person1#: No. He's freeloading and said he has no intention of giving back my money because I don't deserve it with the way I act.
#Person2#: He has a nerve doesn't he? How dare he?!!!
#Person1#: I've learnt to hate him with a passion. He's like vermin that you can't cull.
#Person1#: Abusive, nasty, annoying, irresponsible. He disgusts me.
#Person2#: Get rid of him! I told you right from the beginning that he's no good.
#Person1#: Yeah you were absolutely right.. as always.
#Person2#: I hate to say it but I can smell a fucktard a mile away.
#Person1#: I seem to pick them, don't I?
#Person1#: Sometimes I think it is my fault. If only I could be a better person, if only, if only....
#Person2#: You know that way of thinking will get you nowhere fast. It's self defeating. That's what the abusers want you think that you're bad and you deserve every bit of abuse that they dish out.
#Person1#: What if he doesn't leave? I'm afraid of asking him to leave 'cause it will only cause another fight.
#Person2#: You can't spend your whole life walking on eggshells.
#Person1#: Yeah, you're right... but how do I get out of this mess?
#Person2#: I think you've got to cut your losses and just move on.
#Person1#: Easier said than done.
#Person2#: I know. You've gotta do it Hon. If you don't things will only get worse. Think of how much worse they've already got since you met him.
#Person1#: Yeah you're right. Sometimes I just don't have the strength.
#Person2#: I believe in you. Please do it! Remember I'm always there for you.
summary: #Person1# is about to break up with her boyfriend. #Person2# knew from the beginning that they were not a good match. #Person2# is going to support #Person1#.

dialogue:
#Person1#: Yeah, but u can also read the news online[WINK]
#Person2#: I know, but imagine - ur keen on technology and u get all the news in one place. Then u can choose what to read and what not.
#Person1#: Sounds sensible. Does it have something 4 fashion?
#Person2#: Probably so. Not sure, though.
#Person1#: How about u, Vic?
#Person3#: I still prefer Facebook. Had Twitter once, but the interaction with others is nothing compared with Facebook.
#Person2#: Well, it's intended in a completely different way.
#Person3#: What do u mean?
#Person2#: IMO, Twitter is not for interacting like on Facebook, but for getting news fast and from reliable, more or less, sources. U can follow anyone and anyone can follow u.
#Person3#: Still, on Facebook I can share stuff with my friends, join groups and talk about things that interest me. And I don't have to limit myself to 140 characters.
#Person2#: 280. Still, a downside. OTOH, if ppl were able to write as much as they wanted, Twitted would get as cluttered as Facebook.
#Person1#: So no one uses 4 example Instagram?
#Person3#: I do.
#Person2#: Not 4 me. I don't post that many pictures online.
#Person1#: But u can follow ppl and see what they're doing or offering. There are also companies on Instagram.
#Person2#: I know, but I'm more interested in news and gossip than seeing someone post a picture of their breakfast.
#Person3#: That's not all ppl post on Instagram!
#Person2#: So, what else?
#Person3#: Depends on ur interest. I, for one, like to observe all the fitness accounts[HAPPY]
#Person2#: And does this motivate u to train?
#Person3#: No, but it gives me hints what to do and what not.
#Person1#: What do u think about Tumblr?
#Person2#: What?
#Person3#: Heard about it, but never had an account.
#Person1#: It's a microblogging website. U can post blog entries, pictures and basically everything u want there. And ppl can observe u!
#Person2#: Don't have that much time to write a blog.
#Person3#: Me neither.
#Person2#: Nancy, y do u ask these questions?[WINK]
#Person1#: I have my reasons[WINK]
summary: #Person1# asks #Person3# and #Person2# about various social media, which prompts them to discuss and compare the different platforms. #Person2# is not into Instagram but likes Twitter. #Person3# prefers Facebook over Twitter and likes Instagram. #Person2# and #Person3# both don't use Tumblr.

dialogue:
#Person1#: I'm curious. How's the waste management working out over there?
#Person2#: It actually works very well. We use three different bins: compost, recycle and trash. Compost anything organic from yard waste to food scraps. Recycle for paper, bottles, cardboard, plastic, metals. And trash everything else. Why do you ask?
#Person1#: Sheer curiosity. What about general awareness? Plastic bags, etc.?
#Person2#: Very high. No more single use plastic bags in grocery stores. No more straws in restaurants.
#Person1#: Yeah, I read yours was one of the cities that banned them. I wonder when that will get here.
#Person2#: Never...
#Person1#:: What do you mean?
#Person2#: I highly doubt that type of environmental awareness will happen there. People there live in a different world when it comes to that.
#Person1#: People don't have to have any awareness, tbh. It's above them. If there were such decisions made they would follow
#Person2#: That is true. But at the state government level I don't think there is that awareness either. But hopefully I am proven wrong!
#Person1#: Really bizarre. I noticed it's struggling here. On the other hand, it's money.
#Person2#: Money in the sense of?
#Person1#: Reducing waste=lower utilization costs. Do they sort through everything further down?
#Person2#: Yes here they do.
#Person1#: It seems to be the same way here. Dry recyclables, food and general, compost
summary: #Person2# uses three different bins for waste. He doesn't use straws, neither plastic bags. #Person1# and #Person2# agree that environment protection depends on the government.

dialogue:
#Person1#: Hi there! The quince we talked about the other day... Are you still interested?
#Person2#: Hello Noah, but of course I am.Thank you.
#Person1#: Actually William went to collect the rest of them for you immediately. They're in a basket on our terrace, so you call collect them any time.
#Person2#: That's very very kind of him! He's really a darling.
#Person2#: We won't be going your direction any time soon I'm afraid. How long will they keep? Is it windfall?
#Person1#: Both really but they all look very healthy. No bruises afa one can see. Or only odd small ones. They' be alright for a couple of days I guess. The weather's cool.
#Person2#: It would be a shame if they rotted. I'll talk to Frank and maybe to the twins too and go back to you asap.
#Person1#: OK.
#Person2#: Hey Noah, the twins will be on their way from Notts tomorrow afternoon and passing Windfield. Is it alright if they pop in and collect the quince?
#Person1#: Absolutely! In fact anyone can come any time and just take them from our terrace. Of course it would be great to see your twins again. Haven't seen them for ages!
#Person2#: Well we don't see that much of them either[SAD] They'll be coming home this weekend only because of Alexa's ceremony.
#Person1#: Notts is 3 hours' drive away so small wonder they don't fancy it so much.
#Person2#: I don't blame them! We're both happy they've been doing fine at college. Everything's absolutely fine. You don't have William at home all that often either, do you?
#Person1#: He gets 5 days at Xmas by way of "family care" and 2 weeks off spread over the whole year but never longer that 5 days. They have a strict regime at the academy. But after all these years we've learned to cope with it. What worries me is that he seems to have no time to even think about getting married and start a family of his own.
#Person2#: The fate of most military I guess. Hugely unfair I'd say. Like being married to your regiment!
#Person1#: That's what it sounds like when he talks about himself! I never hear a girl's name! And when I ask, he gets brusque.
#Person2#: Oh dear! What could it mean?
#Person1#: No, not what you think! We know from Capt. Broomsberg about their common escapades. Plenty of women but only that sort of women. No strings.
#Person2#: I never even imagined he might be gay! Surely not. But there must be sth else.
#Person1#: We think he's just so obsessively career-minded. Nothing else counts for him.
#Person2#: He's always been very strong-willed. And he knows what he wants. Well if I were you I wouldn't worry at all.
#Person1#: You're probably right. But you know I'd love it so much to have plenty of grandchildren around me.
#Person2#: They'll come, don't you worry! Look the twins will contact you about the quince. Alright?
#Person1#: Sure. Thank you Sophie for a nice chat!
#Person2#: Thank you for the quince!
summary: #Person2# accepts some quince from #Person1#. #Person1# has left the quince in a basket on his terrace and the twins can pick it up any time. The twins are in college. #Person1#'s son is in the military. He is still single but reportedly not gay.

#Person2#: No way!

dialogue:
#Person1#: Oh Linda...Something horrible has happened. I'm so sorry. I have broken one of your green tea cups. Just looked away and brushed it off the table with my skirt. SORRY!

#Person1#: I'm feeling so bad about it. So clumsy of me.
#Person2#: Look. I never really liked the set, so one cup makes no difference. I hardly use it anyway. How come it was on the table BTW?
#Person1#: I was cleaning the cupboards in the dining room.
#Person2#: You did what? Whatever for? The crockery there is more for decoration.
#Person1#: Exactly. I thought they're so pretty, especially the green ones, and then noticed how dusty they are. So I thought I'd be a helpful guest and wash them. I did. And then I made myself a cuppa in the green one. And it happened.
#Person2#: Ya golden! Really! Look, calm down. You are a fantastic guest.
#Person1#: Ya. Smashing. As we say in GB.
#Person2#: You know what? Take out the whole green set. If you like it so much - it is yours.
#Person1#: But Linda! I'm speechless.
#Person2#: Precious! See you in the evening!
#Person1#: CU
#Person1#: And THANK YOU
summary: #Person1#'s a guest at #Person2#'s house. She broke one of #Person2#'s green tea cups when she was cleaning the cupboards. #Person2# doesn't like them and she offers #Person1# the whole set.

#Person1#: Just tell me, what kind of movie would you like to watch?
#Person1#: A romantic comedy, horror, fantasy or something else?

#Person2#: With all the special effects and dynamic action
#Person2#: Something that would be the opposite of my current situation[HAPPY]

#Person1#: I'll find something special for you

#Person2#: Thanks, Stella, my darling. You made my day[HAPPY]
#Person2#: Bye bye

dialogue:
#Person1#: So what do u do there? Drive a tank all the time?
#Person2#: Yes and no. U've got players from around the world and they have their tank squadrons and u battle them. Can be a lot of fun!
#Person3#: So what happens if someone is on a higher level than u? They basically destroy u!
#Person2#: That's not a problem. The game doesn't allow higher ranked players o interact with players out of their range.
#Person1#: What do u mean?
#Person2#: If ur on lvl 5, a player on lvl 30 can't attack u.
#Person3#: Sensible. Unlike WoW.
#Person2#: So what's WoW like?
#Person3#: Imagine having a character u rly like and u give it a lot of ur attention and get experience point, level up and so on. Someone who's played the game for like a year comes and kills u instantly.
#Person1#: Not cool.
#Person2#: Yeah. Y would they allow such a thing?
#Person3#: Well, open world, u can team up with anyone, do quests together, arrange fighting tactics and so on.
#Person1#: Actually, my cousin met his wife there[HAPPY]
#Person2#: Rly?
#Person1#: Yeah. They were playing together for some time, talking and at some point he invited her to a date. Turned out they lived very close to each other[WINK]
#Person3#: That's gr8! And how are they getting along now?
#Person1#: Most fights are about who gets 2 play at a given moment[WINK]
#Person2#: Lol
#Person3#: Well my favourite genre is RPGs[HAPPY]
#Person2#: Can u name a title, except WoW?
#Person3#: I can name a dozen, but one of my personal faves is the Final Fantasy series[HAPPY]
#Person1#: What's this one about?
#Person3#: Don't tell me u haven't heard about the greatest RPG series of all times?
#Person2#: Well, I haven't.
#Person3#: I think I'll have to look for new friends... So embarrassing.
#Person1#: C'mon! Tell us!
#Person3#: Fine... Usually u play a group of friends that have to resolve some kind of crisis. In the last part u play a prince whose kingdom has been destroyed and u try to well get revenge.
#Person1#: Sounds boring.
#Person3#: Believe me, it's not!
summary: #Person1#'s cousin met his wife while playing a game together. #Person3#'s favorite game is the Final Fantasy. #Person1# and #Person2# haven't heard about it.

dialogue:
#Person1#: Gosh, I fucking hate my job!
#Person2#: Oops! Someone is in a mood...
#Person1#: I'm serious, I'm done. Those people are fucked up. I cannot stand it anymore.
#Person2#: Is it that bad?
#Person1#: Even worse...
#Person2#: What this time?
#Person1#: I don't even have time to eat my fucking lunch. It's not normal.
#Person2#: Did you talk to your manager?
#Person1#: Yeah, this retard doesn't get that we're humans not robots. I hate him.
#Person2#: You're gonna quit?
#Person1#: It's not that easy, I gotta find something. I don't want to leave without first finding a new job.
#Person2#: I see. Did you think about IT?
#Person1#: No, why?
#Person2#: Girl, it's the best place to work in! A lot of my friends started as software testers and they are really satisfied. Good money and no rat race.
#Person1#: Zach, are you crazy? I don't have technical studies.
#Person2#: You don't have to. If you have good analytical skills all you need is some online course - Udemy or something. People change their career after years of employment in totally different business. It's not that difficult, really. You should give it a try. Tech is our future.
#Person1#: Hmm... Maybe you're right. I'm still not sure what to do with my career, so... why not.
#Person2#: If you want, I can talk to my friends and they will give you some advice on how to start, what courses to choose and so on.
#Person1#: That would be great, thanks.
#Person2#: UW. In touch.
summary: #Person1# finds the atmosphere at her workplace to be unbearable. Many people switch their career paths and move to the IT sector. #Person1# only needs good analytical skills and an on-line course to start work in IT.

dialogue:
#Person1#: I just had a fight with Chris:/
#Person2#: Oh no, not again
#Person1#: It's not me who started it. I don't know why he says certain stuff, it seems like he's doing it on purpose
#Person2#: What was it this time?
#Person1#: Same thing, as always. Really, he knows what I think and I know what he thinks so I don't bring up certain things. I don't want to argue, but if it keeps happening, I don't see the point of talking to him
#Person1#: I'm angry every single time I talk with him
#Person2#: Eh, I don't get why he keeps doing it. What did he say?
#Person1#: I don't want to get worked up over it again, but really usual stuff. He watched a programme about the refugees and went on a rant about it
#Person2#: oh god
#Person1#: right?! I don't know why I'm still talking with him. I tried to talk some sense into him, apparently with no luck
#Person2#: What did you tell him?
#Person1#: What I usually tell him. He was an immigrant once, he was working abroad, I sent him all the data and research, statistics, everything.
#Person2#: I'm afraid Chris may be too pig-headed for that
#Person1#: Pfff I bet he didn't even read anything. He's just watching the nationalists, Trump and all those idiots, listens to everything they're saying on the telly instead of just thinking for once
#Person2#: I know, to be honest I kind of avoid these subjects when I'm talking with him
#Person1#: Well, I try to as well, but as you can see he can't stop himself
#Person1#: I know he's our friend and we go out often, but I'm not sure I can do it any more, I don't want be friends with someone who thinks that Mexican children are worse and that they should be kept away from the US
#Person2#: Oh my god he said that?
#Person1#: Yes:/
#Person2#: Jesus, I knew he has strong views, but to say something like that? That's a bit too much
#Person1#: You're telling me this. I think we should reconsider this let's say friendship, because if every conversation will lead to something like this, I'm not interested in staying in touch with him
#Person2#: No wonder
summary: #Person1# had a fight with Chris about refugees. He thinks the U.S. should not accept them. #Person1# and #Person2# do not share this opinion. They are having second thoughts about their friendship.

dialogue:

dialogue:

summary: #Person2# shared his collection of fossils with the class, and #Person1# was very impressed. #Person1# would like #Person2# to show the collection for the 4th grade students as well.

dialogue:
#Person1#: Hi Erin, guess what, John and Annie are coming back to London!
#Person2#: Hi Amber, wow that's news.
#Person2#: What caused the change of plans?
#Person1#: John lost his job in Germany!
#Person2#: What:O Seriously?
#Person1#: Yeah, his whole team got liquidated.
#Person2#: No way!?
#Person1#: Yeah, and he was the only one who received an offer from the company to be relocated back to London.
#Person2#: OK, well at least he's not unemployed.
#Person1#: But he didn't accept it.
#Person2#: Why not?!
#Person1#: B/c they only offered him the job after a month & during that time he started searching for a new one.
#Person1#: He got a better offer from a different IT company in London.
#Person2#: Well good for him!
#Person2#: Since they weren't able to appreciate his work and they didn't offer him something right away.
#Person1#: Exactly, but you know what this means for me?
#Person2#: You're going to have to search for a new flat...
#Person1#: Yup, we had an agreement that I would be renting their place until they returned from Germany.
#Person1#: But you know, they planned to be there for at least 5 yrs.
#Person2#: I can imagine that Annie isn't happy with this turn of events.
#Person1#: She's pretty pissed off.
#Person1#: I mean the plan was to save up for a house and only then come back to London.
#Person1#: She had already enrolled in German classes & they were starting to feel at home there.
#Person2#: That's too bad. Sometimes life turns out to be unpredictable.
#Person2#: If you need somewhere to stay for a while, you can always stay at my place.
#Person1#: Thanks Erin! Annie already told me not to worry, that I can stay with them until I don't find something new.
#Person1#: But I've already started searching.
#Person2#: Good luck and let me know if you need any help!
#Person1#: Thanks, ttyl.
#Person2#: Bye!
summary: John and Annie are moving to London because he lost his job in Germany and found a better offer working in IT here. Annie isn't happy with the move. #Person1#, who was supposed to stay in their London flat for 5 years, has to move. #Person2# offers her place but #Person1# plans on staying with John and Annie.

dialogue:
#Person1#: Are you there, Anna?
#Person2#: I am, but I am not called Anna. It's Tim.
#Person1#: Sorry, brother Tim. Anna is just the word for elder brother in my language.
#Person2#: It's a girl's name here. Doesn't sound very brother-like.
#Person1#: My apologies.
#Person2#: So what is your language?
#Person1#: It is Telugu, brother.
#Person2#: is that spoken in India?
#Person1#: Yes, in South east India. Bangalore and Chennai and other places. Nearly 90 million speakers, brother.
#Person2#: Is it one of those written right to left?
#Person1#: No, it is written left to right. It is based on Brahmin script, our writing. If you trace it back far enough it all comes from the Phoenicians, like English writing the same.
#Person2#: Wow.
#Person2#: So it must be pretty big, then, Teluguland?
#Person1#: It is 23 provinces, Anna. But we are not rich as in the north, so many people here are still working for less than a hundred dollars a whole month.
#Person2#: So what is the word for "younger brother" if "Anna" means "elder brother?"
#Person1#: Thammu or Thammadu. You can call me Thammu. I am younger than you.
#Person2#: how old are you, I would have sid about the same as me in your photo.
#Person1#: How old are you, Anna?
#Person2#: 55
#Person1#: Well there you are you see. I am 35 only. So you are my Anna and I am your Thammadu.
#Person2#: Wow sorry to say it but you do look old for 35:
#Person1#: That is because it is not an easy life when you are not earning much money, Anna. We work very hard and have very little. But still we are thankful for what we do have.
summary: #Person1#'s language is Telugu, which is spoken in south east India. It has nearly 90 million speakers; it's written left to right; it's based on Brahmin script. Teluguland has 23 provinces. It's quite poor. "Anna" means "elder brother" and Thammu or Thammadu - "younger brother". #Person2#'s 55, #Person1#'s 35.

dialogue:
#Person1#: Can you believe he even said that about the forests? Raking? Really?

#Person2#: Maybe, but at least we wouldn't be hated around the world and led by an ignorant piece of shit!

#Person1#: Only on the fringe.
#Person2#: Maybe.

#Person2#: Except vote him out!

#Person2#: Closer every day. If only there was a good candidate.

#Person1#: Let me see what's out there and I'll let you know.
#Person2#: Great!

dialogue:
#Person1#: Due to the number of PTO requests this week, we had to decide who will be allowed to take off based on seniority.
#Person2#: I understand.
#Person1#: Unfortunately, you are too low on the totem pole and we will have to deny your request.
#Person2#: Oh, that's too bad! Is there any compromise? I really wanted to have some time with my family.
#Person1#: I can give you first choice of dates the week after, but that's the best I can do.
#Person2#: What if someone cancels?
#Person1#: That is a rare, but yes, I will come to you first.
#Person2#: Thank you.
#Person1#: Again, I'm very sorry.
#Person2#: Could you amend my request for the following week, Monday through Wednesday?
#Person1#: Certainly. That should be no problem.
#Person2#: That's great, at least I'll have a long weekend!
#Person1#: Very true. No problems from my side.
#Person2#: Do I need to initial the change?
#Person1#: Yes, please come see my assistant at your earliest convenience.
#Person2#: Certainly, no problem.
#Person1#: Thank you for being so flexible.
#Person2#: Sure, I understand we can't all be off. You are just trying to be fair.
#Person1#: That's it exactly.
#Person2#: Thank you again for explaining it so well.
#Person1#: My pleasure. Have a nice holiday and enjoy your time off.
#Person2#: Thank you!
summary: On the following week, #Person2# will get her time off from Monday to Wednesday.

dialogue:
#Person1#: Hey, you have a few minutes?
#Person2#: Sure, what's up?
#Person1#: I'm thinking about inviting a few people from work over and I kinda thought that maybe some boardgames would be a cool idea.
#Person1#: And I wanted to consult the expert on the matter[HAPPY]
#Person2#: As you know I'm always happy to share my expertise with anyone willing to listen. You will just need to stop me when I get too wound up[LAUGH]
#Person1#: Haha[HAPPY] Ok, So I know you ran the local club - any tips how to organize a newbie gaming evening? And what games to bring?
#Person2#: yeah, sure - just a few general tips[HAPPY]
#Person2#: Start games before you start drinking[HAPPY] And don't bring any game that is either over-complicated, requires too much time to explain, or god forbid encourages direct conflict - you know, the plotting-scheming stuff. So no Game of Thrones[HAPPY]
#Person2#: Or alternatively you can chose some cooperative games - like Arkham Horror, Robinson Crusoe, Pandemic
#Person1#: Got it[LAUGH]
#Person2#: Also would be great to know what theme they all like - if there is one. And if not then there are some 'vanilla' games - like Codenames or Catan. Any idea what they might be into?
#Person1#: Not really - there are some guys who I know like sci-fi and comic books, but no idea about the girls...
#Person2#: The best way - just talk with them - might be surprised by their tastes and experiences. Maybe some of them are already into gaming? There are nerds in every walk of life[HAPPY]

dialogue:
#Person1#: Hi there! How are you doing?
#Person2#: Hi Mell! We are fine, just the daily grind[WINK] And yourselves?
#Person1#: Not much happening either. An odd phone call with the kids. Or Tad's sister[SAD]( Not much otherwise.
#Person2#: Yeah... Life has become so quite since the kids are out of the house. We had more to get used to it. But it must hard for you. Especially you I mean.
#Person1#: I don't know. Sometimes I even forget that I should be missing them. In a way I do like this peace and quiet now.
#Person2#: Small wonder. You had a hell of a time with them just before they went to college. I'd say you need to recover now.
#Person1#: I guess you're right. But maybe I should feel guilty or something?
#Person2#: Don't be silly! You are a fantastic mom.
#Person1#: Thanks Gloria.
#Person2#: Anyway I'm happy to hear from you again. We should really have a nice do again.
#Person1#: YES! Splendid!
#Person2#: The weather is just brilliant, perfect for a BBQ. What do you think?
#Person1#: I'm all for it. At my place? I'd love it.
#Person2#: Can't be better. I love your garden.
#Person1#: We're thinking about extending the terrace. I must show you my drawings, just a few ideas. It would be great to hear your opinion.
#Person2#: I'd love to. But you know how little I know about garden design, or however you call it.
#Person1#: We'll have a look at them. Now the BBQ. At the weekend I suppose?
#Person2#: Let me check the calendar. Here's our family planner. A horrible name, isn't it? So this weekend suits us fine. At the next one, on Saturday, Mark has penciled something in but I can't read it. So what about this Saturday?
#Person1#: Perfect. At least we know the weather holds. Shall I do the food and you the drinks?
#Person2#: And I'll get us some dessert as well.
#Person1#: Very good indeed. It's always so easy going with you.
#Person2#: Ta! You were thinking about Tad's sister?
#Person1#: I'm afraid so. I'm so happy she moved up to Scotland and I don't have to put up with her trying to run my household. Tad feels relieved too.
#Person2#: Good riddance! I could really never warm up to her.
#Person1#: Nobody can! Anyway she's gone and we're going to have a fantastic barbecue. Without her.
#Person2#: Yes, we are. Oh I'm so happy you've phoned!
#Person1#: Looking forward to our BBQ on Saturday!
#Person2#: So long!
summary: #Person2# and #Person1# plan to have a barbeque at #Person1#'s place on Saturday. They are happy, because Tad's sister moved to Scotland. #Person1# needs #Person2#'s advice on garden design.

dialogue:
#Person1#: Hello. I have had a good look and have done some tests on the mould in your spare bedroom upstairs and in the dinign room.
#Person2#: Hello Andy. Thank you for that, what are your thoughts?
#Person1#: I think it is caused by condensation, as most of the moist settles on and around the windows.
#Person2#: Why is that?
#Person1#: Those are the coldest areas and therefore where the moist in the warm air turns into water. On the windows its just water, on the walls the moist will allow mould to grow.
#Person2#: So why is it all over the spare room walls, and all around the dining room? but not in other rooms?
#Person1#: Probably because they have external walls which are cooler than internal walls.
#Person2#: so why only that bedroom and not the other ones?
#Person1#: I guess those rooms are most effected as the spare room is next to the bathroom and the dining room next to the kitchen.
#Person2#: But why isnt there mould on the kitchen and bathroom itself then?
#Person1#: I think that is because the kitchen doesn't have external walls and the bathroom has only one external wall and a fan in it. The difference when i measured it between internal wall and external wall is about 4 degrees.
#Person2#: Does that mean we need new double glazed windows or new wall insulation?
#Person1#: Not necessarily. that would make a little difference but would still leave you with moist air in the house, so it would just settle somewhere else.
#Person2#: So what would you recommend?
#Person1#: I would install a fan system, or PIV system, which would circulate air to dilute and take some moisture out of the air. It would be installed in your loft and be on continuously during day and night.
#Person2#: That sounds good. would that be sufficient?
#Person1#: If you buy a decent size it will be, but you would also need to treat your walls to get rid of the current mould. That will not go away by itself.
#Person2#: OK, is this something your company can help with?
#Person1#: It is indeed, we can repaint as well if you want.
#Person2#: Good point. Could you please send me a detailed quote for the work via email?
#Person1#: Of course, I will have that done by Friday.
#Person2#: That would be great. And again, thanks for today!
#Person1#: No problem, speak soon.
summary: #Person2#'s house has mould due to condensation. #Person1# will send her a quote for the work needed by Friday.

dialogue:
#Person1#: U know what annoys me the most?
#Person2#: Not being able to watch TV or listen to music without pesky interruptions?
#Person1#: That too, but the thing that annoys me the most is pharmaceuticals, medicine and drugs.
#Person2#: Y? Aren't they good 4 ur health?
#Person1#: They may well be, but not for my wallet!
#Person2#: What do u mean?
#Person1#: I was watching a film last night and suddenly there's a bunch of commercial of different medical products and so on.
#Person2#: And what of it?
#Person1#: Imagine that pharmaceutical companies invent illnesses!
#Person2#: What? Are u sure?
#Person1#: No, I'm not, but in the commercial they mentioned a name of an illness I have never heard of.
#Person2#: So what? There are many illnesses and diseases I've never heard of.
#Person1#: So I did some research. Turns out such a thing does not exist. No medical journal writes about it, no medical forum suggests caution.
#Person2#: That doesn't mean it doesn't exist.
#Person1#: I even found a youtube video of a doctor explaining y it's not an illness.
#Person2#: All right, this is quite serious.
#Person1#: So I put my mind to it and do u know what I came up with?
#Person2#: What?
#Person1#: That in this particular case they're selling mints as medical products!
#Person2#: Srsly?!
#Person1#: Absolutely!
#Person2#: How long do u think they've been lying to us?
#Person1#: Can't be sure, but probably 4ever. Imagine every illness, disease and so on. Where do these come from? Why do they spread so fast?
#Person2#: That is kinda puzzling.
#Person1#: Right?
#Person2#: So why is no one doing anything about it?
#Person1#: Do u know how much the pharmaceutical industry is worth today?
#Person2#: No.
#Person1#: At least $1.2 bln!
#Person2#: Explains a lot.
summary: #Person1#'s most annoyed by pharmaceutical companies. He believes they invent diseases to make money. He discovered that one company is selling mints as medicine for an illness that doesn't exist.
